00065 /*
00066  * \brief NITF_PLUGIN_TRE_GET_DESCRIPTIONS_FUNCTION - Function pointer for returning
00067  * the descriptions available by the plug-in.
00068  */
00069 typedef nitf_TREDescriptionSet* (*NITF_PLUGIN_TRE_GET_DESCRIPTIONS_FUNCTION) (void);
00070 
00071 /*
00072  * \brief NITF_PLUGIN_TRE_SET_DESCRIPTION_FUNCTION - Function pointer for setting
00073  * the description of the given TRE. This will attempt to set the default description
00074  * to the TRE, and will fail (check tre->descrip == NULL for failure) if there
00075  * is no default description found.
00076  */
00077 typedef void (*NITF_PLUGIN_TRE_SET_DESCRIPTION_FUNCTION)
00078 (
00079     nitf_TRE* tre,
00080     nitf_Error* error
00081 );
00082 
00083 /*
00084   \brief NITF_PLUGIN_COMPRESSION_HANDLER_FUNCTION - Function pointer for
00085   compression handler
00086 
00087   The function compresses data from the user supplied buffer into a buffer
00088   allocated by the function. The allocated buffer is returned to the user.
00089   The function will use the system memory allocation and error handling
00090   facilities.
00091 
00092   \ar input     - The input buffer
00093   \ar inputLen  - Length of the input buffer in bytes
00094   \ar output    - Returns the output buffer
00095   \ar outputLen - Returns length of the output buffer in bytes
00096   \ar error     - For error returns
00097 
00098   \return Returns FALSE on error
00099 
00100   On error, the error object is initialized.
00101 */
00102 
00103 typedef int (*NITF_PLUGIN_COMPRESSION_HANDLER_FUNCTION)
00104 (
00105     nitf_Uint8 *input,
00106     nitf_Uint32 inputLen,
00107     nitf_Uint8 **output,
00108     nitf_Uint32 *outputLen,
00109     nitf_Error *error
00110 );
00111 
00112 /*
00113   \brief NITF_PLUGIN_DECOMPRESSION_CONSTRUCT_FUNCTION - Function pointer for
00114   decompression interface object construction.
00115 
00116   The function creates a decompression interface object. The return type is
00117   void * to avoid a dependency the nitf_ImageIO object. The type is actually
00118   nitf_DecompressionInterface *
00119 
00120   \ar compressionType - Compression type code
00121   \ar error           - Error object
00122 
00123   \return Returns the new object or NULL on error.
00124 
00125   On error, the error object is initialized.
00126 */
00127 typedef void * (*NITF_PLUGIN_DECOMPRESSION_CONSTRUCT_FUNCTION)
00128 (
00129     const char *compressionType,
00130     nitf_Error* error
00131 );
00132 
00133 /*
00134   \brief NITF_PLUGIN_DECOMPRESSION_DESTRUCT_FUNCTION - Function pointer for
00135   decompression interface object destruction.
00136 
00137   The function destroys a decompression interface object. The input object type
00138   is void ** to avoid a dependency on the nitf_ImageIO object. The type i
00139   actually nitf_DecompressionInterface **. The object argument is set to NULL
00140   on return
00141 
00142   \ar object  - Object to destroy
00143   \ar error      - Error object
00144 
00145   \return Returns FALSE on error.
00146 
00147   On error, the error object is initialized.
00148 */
00149 /*
00150 typedef int (*NITF_PLUGIN_DECOMPRESSION_DESTRUCT_FUNCTION)
00151   (
00152   void **object,
00153   nitf_Error* error
00154   );
00155 */
00156 
00157 /*
00158   \brief NITF_PLUGIN_DES_CONSTRUCT_FUNCTION - Function pointer for DES
00159   interface object construction.
00160 
00161 
00162   The function creates a DES interface object. The return type is void * to
00163   avoid a dependency on the UserSegment object. The type is actually
00164   nitf_nitf_IUserSegment *
00165 
00166   \ar error           - Error object
00167 
00168   \return Returns the new object or NULL on error.
00169 
00170   On error, the error object is initialized.
00171 */
00172 
00173 typedef void * (*NITF_PLUGIN_DES_CONSTRUCT_FUNCTION)
00174 (
00175     nitf_Error* error
00176 );
